any_other_comments: It was really good to use it!

remun_comment: I don't have a strong sense of what's fair here, but it seems reasonable to me. Frankly though the dev puts in a lot of work too, so I could see it as a three way 0.2/0.2/0.2 split.
any_other_comments: I tend to prefer sound file generation tools over midi tools. Midi to me is a sort of rigid expressive tool, and though I use it, I really want to work directly with sound with AI because it seems to me that this is where the greatest range of expressive possibility is. As a matter of uploading my creativity to the machine, the more power you can provide to NoiseBandNet the better.
It takes long time for waiting the outcomes. I hope this could be better.

Interface needs to be improved somewhat in terms of making it clear what each model and parameter does. I had some MIDI files that weren't valid and couldn't be loaded into my DAW or played in Windows Media Player. There might be a misunderstanding of "Substantial Similarity" in the legal section, as I believe that copyright infringement can be committed without Substantial Similarity.
